data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3529058,"name":"ErikSLee","username":"ErikSLee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erikslee/{size}/157434_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T21:40:28.456Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI have a quick question about one of our \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eYAGSL\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Yet Another Generic Swerve Library\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e robots. The Front Left module drives correctly, but has the encoder inverted (CCW negative). What does the little read line indicate in the dashboard representation (bottom of circle for FL, but top for other 3)?  If I negate that drive motor, its encoder count reports correctly, but it drives in the wrong direction.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/a/5/a5f271144f22033db15f6ff3978fb7cf63b50329.png\" alt=\"image\" data-base62-sha1=\"nG2d7ptIUUpljrK9uFwmp6eWREl\" width=\"317\" the red line indicates the direction the module is facing (as defined by the bevel gear facing left being straight forward). It’s pretty common for our robot to have modules facing the opposite direction of what they are driving because of turn motor optimization (If 180 degrees from the setpoint is closer than the setpoint itself, go to 180 degrees away and invert the drive) which \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eYAGSL\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Yet Another Generic Swerve Library\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e does automatically I believe.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSo from what I understand, the robot is driving fine in this configuration, it’s just the dashboard inconsistency that you’re concerned
